q: Spring Security provides authentication and authorization.
The ______ process verifies who the user is.
The ______ process determines what user can do.
What is a Principal in Spring Security?
The ______ are secret data proving identity.
Authentication contains principal, credentials, and authorities.
The ______ represents a permission or role.
What happens when Spring Security is added?
o: All endpoints are secured by default

q: The ______ secures all endpoints by default.
What is the default username in Spring Security?
Default password is generated and logged at startup.
Where is the default password displayed?
The ______ generated security password appears in logs.
The ______ bean defines security filter configuration.

o: Allows /public/** access, requires auth for rest

q: What prefix does hasRole() add automatically?
The ______ prefix is added to role names.
hasAuthority() does not add ROLE_ prefix.
What is the difference between role and authority?
o: Role has ROLE_ prefix, authority is exact
User has any of specified roles

q: The ______ checks for any matching role.

o: Custom login page at /login, redirect to /home

q: The ______ specifies custom login page URL.
What is the default logout URL?
The ______ URL triggers logout by default.
HTTP Basic sends credentials in header.
What header contains Basic auth credentials?

o: Interface to load user by username

q: The ______ method finds user by username.
BCrypt includes salt in the hash.
The ______ method verifies password matches hash.
The ______ does the actual credential verification.
CSRF is enabled by default in Spring Security.

o: Requires token in request to match server

q: CSRF token must be included in state-changing requests.
CSRF is not needed for JWT-based authentication.

o: Configures CORS for specific origin and methods

q: What is session management in security?

o: Enum defining when to create sessions

q: What does STATELESS session policy mean?
STATELESS is used for JWT APIs.

o: Disables session creation for stateless API
Requires ADMIN role to call method

q: The ______ keyword accesses return value in @PostAuthorize.
What SpEL variable is the current user?

o: Method parameter matches logged user's ID

q: Remember-me uses a cookie for authentication.
OAuth2 enables login with Google, Facebook, etc.

o: Dependency for resource server with JWT

q: The ______ starter protects APIs with JWT.

o: JSON Web Token for secure claims

q: What are the parts of JWT?
The ______ property sets JWT issuer URI.

o: JSON Web Key Set for public keys

q: JWKS contains public keys for JWT verification.

o: Custom authority extraction from roles claim

q: JWT claims can contain custom roles.
What is opaque token in OAuth2?
Opaque tokens are validated via introspection endpoint.
The ______ validates tokens via authorization server.
What is ID token in OIDC?

o: Token to get new access tokens
OAuth2 flow with temporary code exchange

q: Authorization code flow is most secure for web apps.
PKCE is required for public clients.
Client credentials flow has no user interaction.

o: Holds access token for OAuth2 client

q: The ______ stores access and refresh tokens.
Client registration defines client ID and secret.

o: Base class for security SpEL expressions
Custom permission check for editing post

q: What is ACL in Spring Security?
o: Access Control List for object security
Custom error responses for security exceptions
Injects current user into controller method

q: Spring Security adds security headers by default.

o: Creates mock user for security tests

q: csrf() adds CSRF token to test requests.

o: Posts with CSRF token and admin user
Order in which security filters execute

q: Multiple chains allow API and web different security.

o: Adds custom filter before existing filter

q: The ______ stores algorithm ID with hash.
The ______ is more secure than BCrypt.

o: Only deletes items owned by current user

c:
@PostFilter("filterObject.public or filterObject.owner == authentication.name")
public List<Document> getDocuments() { }
o: Returns only public or owned documents

q: The ______ checks authorization based on URL.
The ______ provides fallback for authorization denial.
What is method security expression handler?
The ______ allows ADMIN to have USER permissions.
Role hierarchy uses > to indicate inclusion.
HttpSessionSecurityContextRepository is default for stateful apps.
The ______ strategy shares context with spawned threads.

o: Tracing and metrics for security events
Authorizes access to returned object methods

q: The ______ method enables magic link login.
Passkeys use biometrics or hardware keys.

o: Checks if password is in breach database

q: The ______ prevents use of compromised passwords.

o: Forces all requests to use HTTPS
Stores original request before auth redirect

q: The ______ restores request after successful login.

o: Allows only one session, blocks new login

q: The ______ lists active sessions for user.
What does deleteCookies() do on logout?
The ______ executes custom cleanup on logout.
The ______ logout notifies RP from IdP.

o: Creates validator checking issuer and timestamps

q: createDefaultWithIssuer() validates iss and exp claims.
What is clock skew in JWT validation?
Clock skew allows minor time differences.

o: JSON with token validity and claims
Loads user info from OAuth2 provider

q: OAuth2UserService is called after successful OAuth2 login.
The ______ fetches user info from userinfo endpoint.

o: Loads user from OIDC ID token
Map of user claims from provider
Extend default to add custom logic

q: Custom OAuth2UserService can enrich user data.

o: Custom OAuth2 user loading with enrichment
Custom action after successful OAuth2 login
Custom action after failed OAuth2 login

q: What is default redirect URI pattern?
ClientRegistration holds client ID and secret.
The ______ has Google, GitHub, Facebook configs.
The ______ allows method to run with elevated role.
